Package javelin.model.world.location.town.quest

Class Quest.QuestMarker

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.world.Actor
      • javelin.model.world.location.town.quest.Quest.QuestMarker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Enclosing class:
    Quest
    protected abstract class Quest.QuestMarker
extends Actor
    Simple generic World actor to use with quests. Ideally subclasses need only override Actor.interact(). Sharing a same image, reduces cognitive overload and dependency on art assets while providing a simple, standard "this is related to a Town quest and nothing more" visual feedback. Obviously, not all quests need to employ markers. Many, for example, target existing Locations in the world map.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public java.lang.Boolean destroy​(Incursion attacker)
        Description copied from class: Actor
        Called when an incursion reaches this actor's location.
        Specified by:
        destroy in class Actor
        Returns:
        true if this place gets destroyed, false if the Incursion is destroyed or null if neither.
        See Also:
        Incursion#ignore(Incursion), Incursion.fight(int, int)

      • getcombatants

        public java.util.List<Combatant> getcombatants()
        Specified by:
        getcombatants in class Actor
        Returns:
        Any combatants that are situated in this actor, may return null if this is not a valid request for this type of actor. For performance if a List is returned it should be the canonical one, and thus should not be directly modified by the receiver.
        See Also:
        Combatant.newid()

      • getel

        public java.lang.Integer getel​(java.lang.Integer attackerel)
        Description copied from class: Actor
        Called when an Incursion reaches its target (and for selecting targets).
        Specified by:
        getel in class Actor
        Parameters:
        attackerel - Given an attacking encounter level... (may pass null to locations which should be "absolute" EL)
        Returns:
        the defending encounter level. A null value is allowed for places that should not be conquered. Integer.MIN_VALUE means an automatic victory for the attacker.
        See Also:
        Actor.impermeable, Incursion.fight(int, int), ChallengeCalculator.calculateel(List)
